verses.kjv: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come unto thee.
verses.ct: LORD, listen to my prayer, and let my cry for help reach you.

verses.kjv: Hide not thy face from me in the day when I am in trouble; incline thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.
verses.ct: Don't withdraw your favor from me when I'm in trouble. Turn your ear toward me — when I call out, answer me quickly.

verses.kjv: For my days are consumed like smoke, and my bones are burned as an hearth.
verses.ct: My days vanish like smoke, and my bones burn like glowing coals.

verses.kjv: My heart is smitten, and withered like grass; so that I forget to eat my bread.
verses.ct: My heart is struck down and dried up like grass, so that I even forget to eat my food.

verses.kjv: By reason of the voice of my groaning my bones cleave to my skin.
verses.ct: Because of my constant groaning, I'm nothing but skin and bones.

verses.kjv: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.
verses.ct: I'm like a pelican in the wasteland, like an owl among the ruins.

verses.kjv: I watch, and am as a sparrow alone upon the house top.
verses.ct: I lie awake, like a lonely bird sitting on a rooftop.

verses.kjv: Mine enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.
verses.ct: My enemies mock me all day long; those who rage against me use my name as a curse.

verses.kjv: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping,
verses.ct: I've eaten ashes as if they were food and mixed my drinks with tears,

verses.kjv: Because of thine indignation and thy wrath: for thou hast lifted me up, and cast me down.
verses.ct: because of your fury and your anger — you picked me up and threw me aside.

verses.kjv: My days are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered like grass.
verses.ct: My days fade like an evening shadow, and I wither like grass.

verses.kjv: But thou, O LORD, shalt endure for ever; and thy remembrance unto all generations.
verses.ct: But you, LORD, reign forever; your name endures through every generation.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion: for the time to favour her, yea, the set time, is come.
verses.ct: You will rise up and show mercy to Zion, because the time to show her favor — yes, the appointed time — has arrived.

verses.kjv: For thy servants take pleasure in her stones, and favour the dust thereof.
verses.ct: Your servants cherish even her stones and feel compassion for her very dust.

verses.kjv: So the heathen shall fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.
verses.ct: Then the nations will deeply revere the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth will honor your glory.

verses.kjv: When the LORD shall build up Zion, he shall appear in his glory.
verses.ct: When the LORD rebuilds Zion, he will appear in his glory.

verses.kjv: He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise their prayer.
verses.ct: He will pay attention to the prayer of the desperate and will not dismiss their plea.

verses.kjv: This shall be written for the generation to come: and the people which shall be created shall praise the LORD.
verses.ct: Let this be recorded for a future generation, so that a people not yet created will praise the LORD.

verses.kjv: For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary; from heaven did the LORD behold the earth;
verses.ct: He looked down from his holy place on high; from heaven the LORD gazed upon the earth,

verses.kjv: To hear the groaning of the prisoner; to loose those that are appointed to death;
verses.ct: to hear the groans of the prisoners, to set free those condemned to die,

verses.kjv: To declare the name of the LORD in Zion, and his praise in Jerusalem;
verses.ct: so that the name of the LORD would be proclaimed in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem,

verses.kjv: When the people are gathered together, and the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
verses.ct: when peoples and kingdoms gather together to serve the LORD.

verses.kjv: He weakened my strength in the way; he shortened my days.
verses.ct: He drained my strength along the way; he cut my life short.

verses.kjv: I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are throughout all generations.
verses.ct: I said, 'My God, don't take me away in the middle of my life! Your years span every generation.

verses.kjv: Of old hast thou laid the foundation of the earth: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.
verses.ct: Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.

verses.kjv: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed:
verses.ct: They will come to an end, but you will remain. All of them will wear out like clothing; you will replace them like a garment, and they will pass away.

verses.kjv: But thou art the same, and thy years shall have no end.
verses.ct: But you stay the same, and your years will never end.

verses.kjv: The children of thy servants shall continue, and their seed shall be established before thee.
verses.ct: The descendants of your servants will live securely, and their offspring will be established in your presence.'
